Important Articles.headline: It's been a while since data center equipment company Vertiv's (NYSE: VRT) stock looked like a great value, but that time has come around again.  The ongoing demand for artificial intelligence (AI) applications creates unprecedented data growth, which only means more investment in data centers.  The good news is that the broad-based sell-off in the Nasdaq Composite (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC) and some near-term negative news have brought stocks like Vertiv back into value range, and now could be a great time to buy the stock on a dip.
Important Articles.title: Could This Nvidia Partner Be a Hidden Gem That Boosts Your Portfolio?

Important Articles.headline: Many artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have sold off recently, presenting compelling buying opportunities for patient investors.  Here's why Vertiv Holdings (NYSE: VRT) and Nebius Group (NASDAQ: NBIS) stand out as two exciting AI stocks -- and why Nvidia is also an incredible buying opportunity hiding in plain sight.  Daniel Foelber (Nvidia): Despite blowout earnings and impressive new product innovations, Nvidia stock is down over 12% year to date at the time of this writing.
Important Articles.title: Hold Nvidia? Here Are 2 Unstoppable AI Stocks You Can Also Buy.

Important Articles.headline: Data center equipment maker Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), healthcare technology specialist GE HealthCare Technologies (NASDAQ:GEHC), and electrical protection and connection products company nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT) are all Nvidia collaborators, and they all focus on the AI growth opportunity.  The latest announcement of an Nvidia/GE Healthcare collaboration to "advance innovation in autonomous imaging"  highlights the investment case for GE HealthCare: specifically, the company's opportunity to maximize the value of its equipment by incorporating AI into it.
Important Articles.title: Down 13% to 41%, These 3 Nvidia Partners Are Raging Buys

Important Articles.title: Why Vertiv Holdings Co. (VRT) Crashed On Wednesday?

Important Articles.headline: Shares in data center equipment maker Vertiv Holdings (NYSE: VRT) tumbled more than 11% by 3 p.m. today.  In addition, some analysts have a more negative outlook on Vertiv.  An analyst at Barclays reduced the company's price target on Vertiv to $100 from $111 and maintained an "equal weight" recommendation, citing potential pressure on revenue and margin.
Important Articles.title: Why Shares in Vertiv Crashed Today

Important Articles.headline: U.S. equities were mostly lower at midday as tech stocks dragged down the Nasdaq and S&P 500.
Important Articles.title: Top Stock Movers Now: Nvidia, Vertiv, Dollar Tree, and More
